public abstract class MetaFlag<C>
extends Meta<C>
implements Predicate<C>

Base class for flag descriptors.

Author:
Andres Rodriguez

getDefaultValue

public final boolean getDefaultValue()

asProperty

public final BooleanMetaProperty<C> asProperty()

not

public final Predicate<C> not()
Returns a predicate that evaluates to true if this flag evaluates to false.

and

public final Predicate<C> and(Iterable<? extends Predicate<? super C>> components)
Returns a predicate that evaluates to true if this flag and each of the provided components evaluates to true. The components are evaluated in order (after the flag), and evaluation will be "short-circuited" as soon as a false predicate is found. It defensively copies the iterable passed in, so future changes to it won't alter the behavior of this predicate.

and

public final Predicate<C> and(Predicate<? super C>... components)
Returns a predicate that evaluates to true if this flag and each of the provided components components evaluates to true. The components are evaluated in order (after the flag), and evaluation will be "short-circuited" as soon as a false predicate is found. It defensively copies the array passed in, so future changes to it won't alter the behavior of this predicate.

and

public final Predicate<C> and(Predicate<? super C> other)
Returns a predicate that evaluates to true if both this flag and the provided predicate evaluate to true. The component is evaluated after the flag and evaluation will be "short-circuited" as soon as a false predicate is found.

or

public final Predicate<C> or(Iterable<? extends Predicate<? super C>> components)
Returns a predicate that evaluates to true if any one of this flag or the provided components evaluates to true. The components are evaluated in order (after the flag), and evaluation will be "short-circuited" as soon as a true predicate is found. It defensively copies the iterable passed in, so future changes to it won't alter the behavior of this predicate.

or

public final Predicate<C> or(Predicate<? super C>... components)
Returns a predicate that evaluates to true if any one of this flag or the provided components evaluates to true. The components are evaluated in order (after the flag), and evaluation will be "short-circuited" as soon as a true predicate is found. It defensively copies the iterable passed in, so future changes to it won't alter the behavior of this predicate.

or

public final Predicate<C> or(Predicate<? super C> other)
Returns a predicate that evaluates to true if any of this flag or the provided predicate evaluate to true. The argument is evaluated after the flag and evaluation will be "short-circuited" as soon as a true predicate is found.
